ygData.subject: Re: BroadScope Crawl and out of memory error
ygData.msgSnippet: Thanks Michael and Gordon for your inputs, ... I am running my crawls from commandline so I dont think above might be the case. Once crawl stops due to OOME I
ygData.rawEmail:

From: "Saurabh Pathak" <sau_pathak@...>
Subject: Re: BroadScope Crawl and out of memory error
X-Yahoo-Group-Post: member; u=126110077
X-Yahoo-Profile: sau_pathak


Thanks Michael and Gordon for your inputs,

> Also, was the crawl job that OOME'd started after another job had  
> run w/o a restart of Heritrix between the running of the jobs?  Is 
> this a 
> case of '[ 1123230 ] Out Of Memory after creating mutliple jobs' 

I am running my crawls from commandline so I dont think above might be
the case. Once crawl stops due to OOME I kill all the java threads
before starting another crawl.

> I notice a custom Processor, and HTML parser, in ToeThread #34. It >
> would be interesting to see what URL that thread is working on, and
> for how long. It, or other custom code that's growing a data 
> structure as the crawl proceeds, could be the cause of the OOM. Our
> stock crawler components might hit an OOM for any broad crawl  
> eventually, but typically not so soon with such a large heap.

I looked at my module and dont think that it is creating OOM. To be
sure I ran the crawler without my custom module and I ran out of
memory again. I tried running a broadscope crawl on a debian machine
using the 1.3 snapshot of the CVS head from last week. I also used
BdBFrontier with 50 threads and allocated 1024M heap. This time
crawler ran out of memory after downloaing some 90000 documents. 

here is the relevant output from heritrix_out.log,

--- In archive-crawler@yahoogroups.com, stack <stack@a...> wrote:
> Also, was the crawl job that OOME'd started after another job had run 
> w/o a restart of Heritrix between the running of the jobs?  Is this a 
> case of '[ 1123230 ] Out Of Memory after creating mutliple jobs' 
>
http://sourceforge.net/tracker/index.php?func=detail&aid=1123230&group_id=73833&atid=539099
> Yours,
> St.Ack
>  
> 
> Gordon Mohr (@Internet Archive) wrote:
> 
> > Once an OutOfMemoryError is hit, a crawl attempts to pause, but will 
> > often be
> > unable to proceed in any meaningful way, depending on what
operation was
> > prevented by the OOM.
> >
> > Is the web UI responsive, and can you get a thread report?
> >
> > I notice a custom Processor, and HTML parser, in ToeThread #34. It
would
> > be interesting to see what URL that thread is working on, and for how 
> > long.
> > It, or other custom code that's growing a data structure as the crawl
> > proceeds, could be the cause of the OOM. Our stock crawler components 
> > might
> > hit an OOM for any broad crawl eventually, but typically not so
soon with
> > such a large heap.
> >
> > - Gordon @ IA
> >
